newsitem.title: GREECE: Ecu/drachma, depos trade lower in late dealings.
newsitem.headline: Ecu/drachma, depos trade lower in late dealings.

text.p: The ecu dropped against the drachma on market expectations of ecu sales for drachmas and forex swaps, while interbank depos were trading slightly lower late on Monday, dealers said.
"The ecu fell against the drachma. The market is expecting ecu sales because of forecasts of a declining ecu. Trade was not heavy on Monday," a state-bank dealer said.
Deposits and forex swaps were trading slightly lower, dealers said.
"After news of T-bill interest rate cuts came out, six-month, nine-month and 12-month depos decreased 10 basis points and short-term depos were five points down," a dealer said.
The Greek finance ministry cut gross interest rates on three-, six- and 12-month T-bills by 40 basis points to 9.4, 9.7 and 10.5 percent respectively, effective February 24.
The ministry will also cut the gross interest rate on its two-year zero-coupon bond by 20 basis points to 10.10 effective February 28.
The central bank kept its intervention rate in overnight money unchanged at 11.90 percent.
Bonds had a slow day with prices holding, a bond dealer said.
The mark was quoted at 156.65/70 from Monday's 156.660 fix,
